Perry Mason

2 Seasons | 16 Episodes | TV-MA

Watch NowMAX

​Based on the work of Erle Stanley Gardner, this drama series traces the origins of famed criminal defense lawyer Perry Mason (Matthew Rhys). The second season picks up with Perry in the throes of the Los Angeles legal system during the height of the Great Depression. Alongside crackerjack assistant Della Street (Juliet Rylance) and hardboiled ex-cop Paul Drake (Chris Chalk), the former PI garners a reputation for taking on clients that few would dare to defend. Months after the Dodson trial shook the city, Perry is readjusting to life as a civil attorney when a high-profile murder case brings him back into the fold. As the DA homes in on a pair of brothers from a desolate Hooverville, Perry is thrust into the center of a vast conspiracy and forced to reckon with what it truly means to be guilty.

1 . Chapter 1

Attorney E.B. Jonathan hires struggling PI Perry Mason to solve what could be the case of the decade.

2 . Chapter 2

Sister Alice impulsively offers the Dodsons the church's moral and financial support.

3 . Chapter 3

Mason gains unauthorized access to evidence with help from Virgil, his connection at the morgue.

4 . Chapter 4

Mason and Strickland lean on Virgil for extra-legal assistance. Birdy urges Sister Alice to renounce her claims about baby Charlie.

5 . Chapter 5

While Mason and Della run a solemn errand up north, Strickland tracks down the sergeant originally assigned to the Dodson case.

6 . Chapter 6

As Emily's trial begins and a damning witness testimony takes center stage, Mason attempts to recover from a shaky start.

7 . Chapter 7

Mason works to expose the Radiant Assembly's corrupt finances, and Drake's detective work opens a new avenue in the investigation.

8 . Chapter 8

As the sensational trial winds to a close, Mason, Strickland, Della and Drake attempt to tie up loose ends -- and set the stage for their futures.

Chapter Nine

1933. In the months following the Dodson trial, an aimless Perry leans on Della to keep the law firm afloat. While Paul accepts a job from an unlikely source, corrupt oil scion Brooks McCutcheon recruits Holcomb in his quest to reshape the future of L.A.

Chapter Ten

After a manhunt pegs brothers Rafael and Mateo Gallardo for the McCutcheon murder, Perry initially resists taking the case … until a hunch reels him in. Later, Della goes on a date with a new flame while Paul wrestles with a shocking truth.

Chapter Eleven

As Rafael and Mateo face discrimination from their fellow inmates and the court, Perry continues his push for justice, while Della engages the help of wealthy socialite Camilla Nygaard. Later, Paul chases leads in the Hooverville.

Chapter Twelve

When Paul’s explosive discovery blows a massive hole in Rafael and Mateo’s story, Perry begins to question his clients’ innocence, while Della doubles-down on the case.

Chapter Thirteen

As the Gallardos’ trial nears, Perry attempts to negotiate with the DA. Rafael and Mateo recount the real-life consequences of the McCutcheons’ L.A. expansion. Later, a lead lands Paul in danger, and Perry makes a convincing demonstration in court.

Chapter Fourteen

After he’s subpoenaed, Holcomb offers Perry an olive branch. Meanwhile, Della continues to foster her relationships with Camilla and Anita, giving her the confidence to question her first witness -- and push the verdict in the Gallardos’ favor.

Chapter Fifteen

Facing career-ending accusations and potential jailtime, Perry must turn to Strickland to stay ahead of the prosecution -- and Lydell. With the Gallardos’ fate in the balance, Della presses Hamilton for answers.

Chapter Sixteen

As their final day in court nears, Mateo and Rafael prepare for the worst, while Perry, Della, and Paul work with an unlikely ally. Then, after making his closing arguments, Perry faces the consequences of his relentless pursuit of justice.
